item.description:
Pontifications

  • everybody thinks they're an expert on fixing web browser bugs and how easy it is to add web browser features because they use a web browser daily. I bicycle every day but don't consider myself an expert on bicycle design, repair and maintenance #ymmv

item.title: Kitsune 'products' are defined in the django admin backend
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Following up from Kitsune Questions aka AAQ API, product == 'firefox' is desktop, 'mobile' is Firefox for android, Kitsune products are defined the django admin backend which for security reasons is only accessible by employees.

item.title: Kitsune Questions aka AAQ API, product == 'firefox' is desktop, 'mobile' is Firefox for android
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Just to clarify Kitsune aka support.mozilla.org question API
    • product='firefox' is Firefox for desktop e.g. sample API is:
      • https://support.mozilla.org/api/2/question/?format=json&product=firefox&locale=en-US
    • product='mobile' is Firefox for Android e.g. sample API is:
      • https://support.mozilla.org/api/2/question/?format=json&product=mobile&locale=en-US

item.title: Learning not learning Tagalog and Kapampangan by podcasting
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Over on roland.micro.blog I'm learning not learning :-) Tagalog and Kapampangan by podcasting
  • So far:
    • Marimla Means Cold In Kapampangan :-)
    • Malamig Means Cold In Tagalog :-)
    • I thought Everyone Spoke Kapampangan Just Like Tagalog :-)

item.title: There's nothing special about voice or podcasts, everybody should be able to publish what they: voice, audio, text, video whatever whenever they want to whomever they want
item.description:
Pontifications

  • When the current podcast boom is over, we should all recognize that we can and should be creators of whatever we want and publish it to whoever we want including voice, text, audio, etc

item.title: It's March 15, 2019: My $USD900 Note 8 is still at January Android security patch level i.e. more than 2 months behind: Thanks but no thanks S*msung and F*do
item.description:
Pontifications

  • It's March 15, 2019: My $USD900 Note 8 is still at January Android security patch level i.e. more than 2 months behind: Thanks but no thanks S*msung and F*do
  • At least according to sammobile.com's note 8 on F*do firmware tracker

item.title: Downloaded Stephanie's neon and neon2 flickr galleries before the big flickr March 12, 2019 deletion
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Just in time for the big March 12, 2019 deletion by flickr of non CC photos on free accounts and any non CC photos over 1000 on free accounts which I fully support :-) #ymmv
  • See the original (or biggest available if the originals aren't available) photos here: NEON 1, NEON2
  • And the software:
    • add-synthetic-galleryid-get-gallery-photo-metadata.rb
    • backup-biggest-by-galleryid.rb

Colophon

./add-synthetic-galleryid-get-gallery-photo-metadata.rb 72157675774023387 2>neon2-add-galleryid-stderr.out &
./add-synthetic-galleryid-get-gallery-photo-metadata.rb 72157675752554377 2>neon1-add-galleryid-stderr.out &
cd /home/roland/GIT/neon-for-stephanie/NEON1_ORIGINALS
../backup-biggest-by-galleryid.rb  72157675752554377
cd /home/roland/GIT/neon-for-stephanie/NEON2_ORIGINALS
../backup-biggest-by-galleryid.rb  72157675774023387

item.title: How to move files newer than 60 minutes ago to another directory
item.description:
Pontifications

  • See Move files to another directory which are older than a date
find .  -maxdepth 1 -mmin -60 -name '*.jpg' -exec mv "{}" ../NEON2_ORIGINALS \;

item.title: I'm sure I've overanalyzed this but I'm going to back to my Windows Surface Charger Theory because Windows Explorer crashed and my battery was at 6%
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I'm sure I've overanalyzed this but I'm going to back to my Windows Surface Book 2 Charger is broken theory because Windows Explorer crashed and my battery was at 6% yesterday. Maybe my charger overheats or is defective and stops charging?!?!

item.title: Use Martin Krzywinski's colorsnap utility to create green, black, white, and pink camo from multiple images?!?
item.description:
Pontifications
